data.title: LaGuardia Airport [LGA] â Ultimate Terminal Guide
data.meta_description: From LGA's airport lounges to nearby hotels, car rental and important phone numbers --- we've got it covered in this in-depth airport guide.
data.text:
LaGuardia Airport (LGA) operates domestic flights to the East Coast and central areas of North America with a longstanding maximum flight radius of up to 1,500 miles for LGA flights, excluding Denver (DEN) and Saturday flights.

LGA is the busiest U.S. airport (for passenger numbers) without a direct route to Europe. Itâs been criticized for its outdated facilities, but after half a decade of redevelopment, LGAâs new Terminal C and revamped Terminal B offer a more streamlined passenger experience with spacious and modern amenities.

As a domestic hub for Delta Air Lines, the airline was a significant contributor to LGAâs expansion project.

Quick Information

Airport: LaGuardia Airport (LGA)

Terminals: 3 total, including A, B, and C

Airport Address: LaGuardia Road and 94th Street, Queens, NY 11371

Distance from Manhattan: 8 miles (13 km)

Website: laguardiaairport.com

Phone Number: 718-533-3400

Destinations Served: 86

Flight Information: Departures and arrival information can be viewed online

LGA Terminal Map

Airlines Operating From LGA

Terminal A

Frontier Airlines

Spirit Airlines

Terminal B

Terminal C

LGA Airport Terminals

LaGuardia Airport has 3 terminals â A, B, and C â that are not linked to each other, so passengers must ride the airport shuttle bus should they need to travel between terminals.

The Grand Central Parkway runs along the south of the airport, so if youâre traveling to LGA by car, you can access your required terminal easily by taking the signposted road system from the parkway.

Each terminal has parking facilities close by and car rental facilities are mostly south of the Grand Central Parkway, accessible by shuttle bus.

Terminal A

Terminal A is also known as the Marine Air Terminal, as it was initially built to manage seaplane operations. Terminal A is located on the west side of the airport and is occupied by Frontier and Spirit.

Departures is accessible from the circular art deco rotunda that leads through to the check-in area. The departure concourse has 6 gates numbered A1 to A6 with arrivals located on the same level as departures.

Terminal B

Terminal B is in the central area of the airport and has 2 concourses. Terminal B recently underwent a major redevelopment and its new departure and arrivals areas were unveiled in June 2020. The terminal now consists of 4 levels, including a new concessions level with shops and restaurants.

Level 2 â Baggage Claim

The baggage claim carousels can be found on level 2, along with a welcome center and shop. Passengers can be picked up curbside, and a taxi rank is located on this level for on-demand taxi services. Passengers can access the walkway to the Terminal B parking garage from the west end of the terminal.

Level 3 â Ticketing and Check-In

Airline ticketing and check-in desks are located on level 3, and the security checkpoint is just beyond the ticketing desks, providing access to the departure concourses.

Level 4 â Shops and Restaurants

Post-security, an escalator takes passengers up to level 4, where there are quick- and full-service dining options and shopping.

Other amenities include a meditation room, nursing room, and pet relief area.

Passengers can access the eastern and western concourses by walking across the concourse bridges from this level.

Eastern Concourse

The Eastern Concourse is a newly developed concourse with 19 gates numbered 40 to 49 and 51 to 57. Thereâs a good selection of shops and restaurants, including LGA Duty-Free and Shake Shack. An Admiralâs Club is located on the upper level and a childrenâs play area is on the lower level entering the concourse.

Gates 11 to 31

Gates 11 to 31 are located at the northern end of Terminal B and passengers can reach the concourse from level 4 of the terminal. Air Canada, American Airlines, JetBlue, Southwest, and United Airlines operate flights from the 19 gates, numbered 11, 12, 14 and 20, and 22 and 31. Thereâs a childrenâs play area in the central area of the concourse and an Admirals Club on the upper level.

Terminal C

LGAâs new Terminal C is almost double the size of the 2 terminals that it replaced, with all passengers experiencing the new, spacious terminal when flying from 1 of its 4 concourses. All 4 concourses are interlinked inside the secure area, making connections quicker and easier.

Level 1 â Baggage Claim

Baggage claim is located on level 1, along with a cafÃ©, shop, and welcome center.

Level 2 â Check-In

Check-in for Delta Air Lines and WestJet is located on level 2. Passengers can proceed to level 3 to clear security and access the departure concourses, and a large Delta Sky Club is located on level 4.

Gates 60 to 69

This concourse has 8 gates numbered 60, 60A, 61, and 62 to 69. Thereâs a small selection of shops including Tumi and Swarovski, and a food court with several restaurants.

Gates 70 to 79 is the next concourse over from gates 60 to 69 and is just a short in-between using the airside walkway. Inside the conourse are a few cafes and restaurants, including a Starbucks, pet relief area, and nursing room.

Gates 81 to 89

When you clear security, gates 81 to 89B are to the right and down the escalators. There are a couple of shops for last-minute snacks and entertainment, and a few restaurants to grab a bite before taking off.

Gates 92 to 98

At the eastern end of the terminal are gates 92 to 98, where there are few concessions available, but passengers can walk easily between the other concourses to make use of the amenities.

Hot Tip: For more information, see our in-depth guide on how to get between terminals at LGA Airport.

Inter-terminal Transport

Connecting Outside of the Secure Area

LGA operates courtesy shuttle buses to transport passengers between terminals and to and from the parking lots and car rental transfer points.

Buses run 24 hours a day, every 8 to 10 minutes at peak times and every 15 minutes off-peak.

The location of the buses is GPS-tracked, and passengers can use the airportâs tracker to see live bus arrival times.

Security and Customs at LGA

Each terminal has a different layout and number of security checkpoints, depending on its size and the volume of passengers that it serves.

All terminals have 1 security checkpoint, apart from Terminal D which has 2.

Passengers can check ahead for estimated security wait times on the airport website.

TSA PreCheck

LGA has 1 dedicated TSA PreCheck standard checkpoint lane each at Terminals A, B, and C. Opening hours vary, so itâs best to check the TSA website:

LGA does not have a TSA PreCheck Enrollment Center on airport property. The nearest enrollment center is located around 2 miles away at Staples, 24-41 31st St., Astoria, NY 11102-1140.

Global Entry

Global Entry is not available at LaGuardia Airport.

CLEAR

LGA has CLEAR lanes in Terminal C for eligible passengers that have enrolled and for those that wish to enroll. These are open daily from 4:30 a.m. to 9 p.m.

B-Fast

Passengers departing from Terminal B can skip the line for security by purchasing a B-Fast pass. A prebooked pass costs $15 or an instant-access pass purchased on the day of costs $20.

Mobile Passport Control

Mobile Passport Control is not accepted at LaGuardia Airport.

LGA Airport Lounges

There are 6Â lounges at LaGuardia Airport, with some located inside the secure area and some outside.

The Admirals Club and United Club lounges allow passengers to purchase a day pass to enjoy their facilities (subject to capacity allowance,) while the other lounges are exclusively for premium cabin passengers, elite status frequent flyers, or eligible credit cardholders.

*Hours are subject to change without notice. Lounge access may be restricted at times due to capacity.

**Day Pass for any passenger. Lounges marked as N/A only allow entry for eligible passengers in their premium cabins, frequent flyer programs, or participating credit card programs.

Priority Pass Access

Minute Suites Express accepts Priority Pass holders and offers members (and up to 3 guests) 1 hour of free access. You can find Minute Suites in Terminal B.

Priority Pass Members can also access the Be Relax Spa in Terminal B.

Priority Pass members who also have a Chase Sapphire ReserveÂ®, J.P. Morgan Reserve Card, or The Ritz-Carltonâ¢ Credit Card get unlimited access to the Chase Sapphire Lounge by The Club. Priority Pass members without one of those cards can access this lounge for free once per year.

Find out more information on becoming a Priority Pass member by reading our dedicatedÂ Priority Pass article, as well as a guide toÂ cards thatâll pay for your membership fee.

Hot Tip: Avoid paying lounge entry fees simply by having a credit card that offers complimentary lounge access.

Airport Dining and Drinks at LGA

LGA has 59 restaurants, cafes, and grab-and-go options throughout the airport, so there are plenty of choices to grab a bite before your flight. There are only 1 or 2 options outside of the secure area in all terminals, apart from Terminal B, so head there if youâre too early to check in.

If you want to check out your options before you arrive, head to the airportâs website where you can filter restaurants by terminal and see whatâs available pre- and post-security.

LGA Airport Wi-Fi and Charging Stations

LGA provides free and unlimited Wi-Fi to passengers and guests in all public areas.Â To connect, follow these steps:

Select â_Free LGA WiFiâ from your available connections

Launch your browser and youâll be on your way

For any connectivity issues, contact the 24/7 customer support line at 800-880-4117.

Charging Stations: There are charging stations located at:

Terminal A: Near gates A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, and A6

Terminal B: Near gates 47, 51, and 55

Terminal C: Near gates 81, 92, 94, 96, and 98

Hot Tip: Not all airports offer free Wi-Fi. If you donât want to worry about being disconnected, you may want to pick up a mobile hotspot to keep you connected.Â

LGA Airport Lost and Found

The process for lost and found property depends on where an item was misplaced.

If you lose something within one of the terminals or on a taxi or bus, then the airport advises emailing lgalostandfound@panynj.gov with a detailed description of the item and circumstances, such as the date and location.

If an item was left on an airplane, then contact the airline directly.

If you lose something while passing through security, then contact TSA lost and found at 866-289-9673 during the hours of 9 a.m. to 8 p.m.

Additional Airport Information

Information Services

LGA has guest services desks in the following locations:

Terminal A arrivals hall

Terminal B:

Arrivals hall

Eastern concourse

Level 4 retail hall

Western concourse

Terminal C

Near gate 60A

Near gate 82

Travelers Aid

There is no travelers aid center at LGA. The nearest center is located at JFK Airport.

Childrenâs Play Areas

There are 2 childrenâs play areas located in Terminal B, near gate 24 and the central area of gates 40 to 59. LGA ranks one of the top on our list of the most kid-friendly U.S. airports.

Baby Facilities

LGA has 9 nursing rooms located at:

Terminal A: Just beyond the TSA checkpoint

Terminal B: Near gates 12 and 42

Terminal C: Baggage claim, the connector between gates 81 to 89B and 92 to 98, the entrance of gates 61 to 69, near gate 76, and at Delta Sky Club

Pet Relief Areas

While LGA doesnât rank among the top 10 pet-friendly U.S. airports, the airport has 4 dedicated pet relief areas:

Terminal A: Curbside

Terminal B: Curbside, entrances of the Eastern and Western Concourses, level 4 retail hall

Terminal C: Entrance of gates 61 to 69, connector between gates 81 to 89B and 92 to 98

Duty-Free

LGA has 1 duty-free shop located in Terminal B Eastern Concourse, near gate 48.

Smoking Areas

Designated smoking areas are located outside of the terminals. LGA is a smoke-free airport inside, including the use of electronic cigarettes.

Prayer

There are no chapel services at LGA, but there is a meditation room located on level 4 in the Terminal B food court (temporarily closed).

Money

ATMs can be found in these locations:

Terminal B: East side of level 1, baggage claim, near gates 42 and 57, and on level 4

Terminal C: Near gates 63, 81, and 92

Medical Center

LGA does not have a dedicated medical center.

Luggage

There are no luggage storage lockers inside the airport.

Important LGA Phone Numbers

General Inquiries: 718-533-3400

Parking: 347-468-3928

Travel To and From LGA

Transport Options

Train

Subway: LGA does not have a subway station at the airport, but passengers can ride the M60 bus to 125 Street Station to access subway lines 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, A, B, C, and D. The bus transfer is free for passengers using a MetroCard, with buses departing from outside all terminals. A single journey by public bus or subway is $2.75.

Metro-North Railroad: For connections to the suburban north, ride the Metro-North Railroad from Harlem-125th Street. Take the free transfer bus (as described above), as Harlem-125th Street Station is close to 125th Street Station (subway).

Long Island Rail Road: This commuter train runs from Manhattan to the end of Suffolk County and is accessible from Woodside station at 61st Street/Roosevelt Avenue. To reach the station, ride the Q70 bus from any terminal.

Bus

MTA Bus M60: Several public buses can transport passengers around Queens and to Manhattan, Long Island, and beyond. The M60 bus departs from all terminals, stopping at 125th Street for subway lines 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, A, B, C, and D.

âLaGuardia Linkâ Q70 SBS Bus: The Q70 bus departs from Terminal C running to 74th Street/Roosevelt Avenue for subway lines 7, E, F, M, and R. This bus is free of charge.

Other Public Buses: The Q47 serves Queens and 74th Street/Roosevelt Avenue, departing from Terminal A. The Q72 serves Queens and 63rd Drive/Rego Park, departing from Terminal C, and the Q48 serves Queens and Main Street/Roosevelt Avenue, departing from Terminal B.

Shuttle

Shared-ride and private-ride shuttles are available to pre-book or arrange on arrival. These depart from the Terminal B parking garage level 2, and on arrival, you can visit the Welcome Center in the arrivals hall for more information.

Taxi

Metered taxis are available from outside all terminals. No flat rates are available from LGA but a rough cost from the airport to Times Square is around $40 (not including tips or tolls).

Ride Services

Approved app services such as Uber or Lyft can pick up and drop off from the Terminal B parking garage on Level 2.

Driving to LGA

Arriving From Manhattan

Via the Midtown Tunnel: Continue on I-495 East. Take exit 17E for I-278 E towards the Bronx. Keep right and take I-278 East, then keep right at the fork to continue on Brooklyn Queens Expressway East. Merge onto the Grand Central Parkway and take exit 7 towards Terminal B/Terminal C/Terminal D/LaGuardia Airport.

Via the Robert F. Kennedy Bridge: Take I-278 West and keep left to continue on Grand Central Parkway. Use the right 2 lanes to take exit 7 towards Terminal B/Terminal C/Terminal D/LaGuardia Airport.

Via the Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge:Â Continue on Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge Lower Roadway, then keep right to continue on Queens Boulevard. Take the slip road onto I-278 East, then keep right at the fork to stay on Brooklyn Queens Expressway East. Merge onto the Grand Central Parkway and take exit 7 towards Terminal B/Terminal C/Terminal D/LaGuardia Airport.

Arriving From Brooklyn

Via I-278: Take I-278 East and use the right 2 lanes to take exit 7 towards Terminal B/Terminal C/Terminal D/LaGuardia Airport.

Via the Jackie Robinson Parkway: Follow Atlantic Avenue to the Jackie Robinson Parkway, then take exit 8W for Grand Central Parkway West towards Triboro Bridge. Take exit 6 towards LaGuardia Airport/Terminal B/94th Street.

LGA Airport Parking Information

Official Airport Parking

Depending on how long youâre traveling for, LaGuardia has both short- and long-term parking lots available.

Short-term Parking

LGA has 3 terminal parking garages, located outside each terminal. The following charges apply to the Terminals A, B, and C parking garages:

Long-term Parking

LGA has 2 alternative parking lots that offer cheaper rates for long-term parking. LaGuardia Discount Parking is available at 46-10 Berrian Blvd and charges the following rates:

Prepaid economy parking is available south of Terminal 1 and charges:

Shuttle buses operate between the terminals and all of the parking lots and garages. LaGuardia Discount Parking and the prepaid economy parking lots must be booked in advance.

Hot Tip: You can save over 10% by pre-booking your parking online.

Premium parking is available in the Terminal C parking garage and guarantees you a space closest to the terminal.

Covered parking is available at all parking garages, and shuttle buses transport passengers to their required terminals.

Terminal B parking has electric vehicle charging stations available on the third floor and the Terminal C parking garage has these on the second floor.

Pick-up or Drop-off Parking

The cell phone lot is located on 94th Street between 23rd Ave and Ditmars Blvd and offers free parking to friends/family waiting to pick up passengers. Vehicles must not be left unattended, and once the passenger has called for a pick-up, the driver can make their way to the curbside pick-up area of the terminal.

Off-site and Hotel Parking

Daily parking at LGA is quite expensive and a cheaper alternative is to book off-site parking at a hotel or parking facility.

Daily parking starts at $15, with parking lots offering courtesy shuttle services to and from LGA. Many third-party websites offer the ability to pre-book parking, and airportparkingreservations.com is one such website that has excellent customer reviews on Trustpilot.

Parking for Passengers With Disabilities

For customers with restricted mobility, designated parking spaces are available in each official airport parking garage, and are located closest to the terminal entrance.

Parking is at a reduced rate:

First 30 Minutes: $4

Each Additional 30 Minutes: $4

24-hour Maximum: $29

General Parking Inquiries: 347-468-3928

Request a Parking Extension Over 30 Days: 718-533-3850

Car Rental at LGA Airport

Car rental companies are based on airport property, a little distance from the terminals.

Shuttle buses depart regularly to transport passengers to and from Terminals A and B to the rental car facility.

These rental car companies are based at LGA:

Hot Tip: If youâre looking to save some money, check out our guide to cheap car rentals in New York City.

LGA Airport Hotels

There are no hotels on airport property. However, many hotels offer courtesy shuttle services to and from the airport.

The closest hotels are located just south of the Grand Central Parkway and range from 1 to 3 stars.

Weâve listed some of the most popular hotels below, featured in order of distance from the airport.

LGA Airport Hotels â Sorted by Distance From LGA

Top 3 Hotel Stays Using Points

The 438-room New York LaGuardia Airport Marriott is less than a mile from LGA and offers a free airport shuttle. There is also convenient access to Citi Field and Arthur Ashe Stadium. Amenities include on-site restaurants, a 24-hour front desk, a 24-hour fitness center, and free Wi-Fi. The hotel charges from 31,000 Marriott Bonvoy points per night.

While small at just 50 rooms, the Wyndham Garden LaGuardia South features free Wi-Fi and a modern fitness facility. The hotel has a Starbucks on-site for those that need a quality caffeine option. The hotel is located near major shopping centers including the Queens Center Mall. Their on-site restaurant, BLVD Bistro & Bar, serves up hearty and light meal options as well as a full cocktail menu. Wyndham Rewards members can use their points for a free night at just 30,000 points per room.

Hyatt Place Flushing LaGuardia Airport hotel is conveniently located atop a retail center. The center features a choice of great restaurants and shopping options. Guests can also enjoy the free airport shuttle, rooftop outdoor garden, and indoor swimming pool. For food and drink, the on-site restaurant and lounge offer views of the Manhattan skyline. World of Hyatt loyalty members can book a free night at this Category 3 hotel from just 9,000 points per night and receive a complimentary breakfast to boot!

Hot Tip: If youâre looking to top off your points to stay at any of these options, see our guides on the best ways to earn more Marriott Bonvoy, Wyndham Rewards points, or World of Hyatt points.

Final Thoughts

Having been publicly criticized by passengers and politicians, itâs a welcome relief that LaGuardia has finally had the face-lift it so desperately needed.

June 2022 unveiled the redevelopment of Terminal C, consolidating 37 gates into 1 spacious terminal operated by Delta Air Lines. This, in addition to the revamped Terminal B, has transformed the passenger experience, with modern architecture and state-of-the-art technology.
